articles.author: Michelle Nichols
articles.description: The United Nations General Assembly on Friday overwhelmingly backed a Palestinian bid to become a full U.N. member by recognizing it as qualified to join and recommending the U.N. Security Council "reconsider the matter favorably."
articles.title: UN General Assembly backs Palestinian bid for membership

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: The United Nations warned on Friday that aid for the Gaza Strip could grind to a halt in days, as Israeli troops took their ground war with Palestinian fighters into the crowded city of Rafah, a key aid corridor for the famine-threatened strip.
articles.title: UN sounds alarm over aid as Israel pushes assault into Rafah

articles.author: Sergiy Karazy, Tom Balmforth, Yuliia Dysa
articles.description: Russian forces launched an armoured ground attack on Friday near Ukraine's second city of Kharkiv in the northeast of the country and made small inroads, opening a new front in a war that has long been waged in the east and south.
articles.title: Russian forces attack Ukraine's Kharkiv region, opening new front

articles.author: Dave Graham
articles.description: An upcoming Ukraine peace summit, ostensibly the most ambitious bid in years by neutral Switzerland to mediate a major conflict, is instead showing how Swiss economic and security interests increasingly align with Western Europe over Russia.
articles.title: Ukraine peace summit pushes neutral Swiss toward Western embrace

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin proposed the reappointment on Friday of Prime Minister Mikhail Mishustin, a technocrat who has helped him through the war in Ukraine and the economic challenges wreaked by Western sanctions over Moscow's invasion.
articles.title: Putin, seeking continuity, proposes Mishustin remain Russia's prime minister

articles.author: Luc Cohen, Jody Godoy
articles.description: Donald Trump returned to court on Friday after porn star Stormy Daniels' lurid testimony about her alleged sexual encounter with him, as prosecutors prepared to call their final witnesses in the first-ever criminal trial of a sitting or former U.S. president.
articles.title: Trump arrives at hush money trial as prosecutors prepare for final witnesses

articles.author: Fayaz Bukhari
articles.description: Opposition leaders in India's troubled Kashmir valley have accused Prime Minister Narendra Modi's administration of denying or cancelling permissions to hold campaign events, to help his party's "proxies".
articles.title: Opposition leaders in India's Kashmir accuse government of sabotaging their campaigns

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Philippine national security council on Friday called for Chinese diplomats to be expelled from the country for what it called a malicious disinformation campaign that had breached local laws and diplomatic protocols.
articles.title: Philippines calls for Chinese diplomats to be expelled for disinformation

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: At least 60 people were injured on Friday when a seven-car passenger train collided with a locomotive and an empty train car in Buenos Aires, local authorities said, without giving details of how serious the injuries were.
articles.title: Sixty injured in Buenos Aires train collision

articles.author: Johan Ahlander, Anna Ringstrom
articles.description: Israel's Eden Golan has become one of the favourites among bookmakers to win this year's Eurovision Song Contest after she made it through the semi-finals on Thursday despite boos during her performance and protests outside the venue in Sweden.
articles.title: Israel emerges among top favourites to win Eurovision
